jwt.title: JWT Decoder
jwt.description: Decode and inspect JSON Web Tokens
jwt.invalidFormat: Invalid JWT format. Expected 3 parts separated by dots.
jwt.decodeError: Failed to decode token. Make sure it's a valid JWT.
securityTips: This is a client-side JWT generator for testing only
Never expose your secret keys in production
JWTs generated here are signed but not encrypted
Use strong, random secrets for production environments

secureKey.title: Secure Key Generator
secureKey.description: Generate cryptographically secure random keys for APIs, encryption, and secrets
tips: Use 256-bit (32 bytes) or higher for encryption keys
Store keys securely using environment variables or key management systems
Never commit keys to version control
Use different keys for different environments (dev/staging/prod)

csrf.title: CSRF Token Generator
csrf.description: Generate cryptographically secure CSRF tokens for your applications
tips: Generate a unique token for each user session
Store tokens securely (server-side session or HttpOnly cookies)
Validate tokens on every state-changing request
Use appropriate token length (32+ bytes recommended)

emailHeader.title: Email Header Analyzer
emailHeader.description: Analyze email headers to detect spoofing, phishing, and trace message routes

http.title: HTTP Status Code Lookup
http.description: Quick reference for HTTP status codes and their meanings
http.searchPlaceholder: Search by code, name, or description...

100.name: Continue
100.description: The server has received the request headers and the client should proceed to send the request body.

101.name: Switching Protocols
101.description: The requester has asked the server to switch protocols and the server has agreed to do so.

200.name: OK
200.description: Standard response for successful HTTP requests.

201.name: Created
201.description: The request has been fulfilled, resulting in the creation of a new resource.

400.name: Bad Request
400.description: The server cannot or will not process the request due to an apparent client error.

401.name: Unauthorized
401.description: Authentication is required and has failed or has not yet been provided.

403.name: Forbidden
403.description: The request was valid, but the server is refusing action. The user might not have the necessary permissions.

404.name: Not Found
404.description: The requested resource could not be found but may be available in the future.

500.name: Internal Server Error
500.description: A generic error message when an unexpected condition was encountered.

speedTest.title: Network Speed Test
speedTest.description: Check your internet connection speed, ping, and jitter instantly.
speedTest.disclaimer: * Latency is measured to Google. Download uses Wikimedia CDN. Upload uses HttpBin. Results are estimates and depend on browser performance.

mindflow.title: MindFlow - Mind & Concept Map
mindflow.description: MindFlow is a free tool that allows you to create concept and mind maps using a drag-and-drop method. Its use is very practical and easy. It is a useful application for people to learn concepts more easily and permanently.
mindflow.helpTitle: What is it and How to Use?
mindflow.a1: MindFlow is a drag-and-drop mind mapping tool used to visualize complex ideas.
mindflow.a2: You can create new boxes by clicking Add Node, move them by dragging, and manage connections between them.
